article.title: No truthful mechanism can be better than $n$ approximate for two natural problems

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the variable \'t\' represent in Figure 1?
choices: The cost of an edge belonging to a specific agent in a specific block.
The number of blocks in the chain graph.
The total cost of the path.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the transformation shown in Figure 3, how many rightward edges are added for each original edge in a block?
What does Equation 10 indicate about the relationship between the shortest path length (SP(t)) and the min-max optimum (OPT(t)) in the context of the min-max path problem?
choices: OPT(t) is always equal to SP(t).
OPT(t) is always greater than SP(t) by a factor of n.
OPT(t) is always less than SP(t) by a factor of n.
OPT(t) is bounded between SP(t) / n and SP(t).

multiple_choice_question.text: In the context of proving the n-approximation property of the VCG mechanism, what does the formula represent?
choices: The social cost of the solution x.
The maximum cost incurred by any agent for solution x.
The minimum cost incurred by any agent for solution x.
The total payment made to the agents for solution x.
